shark.imgAlt1: A shark at rest in the water
shark.imgAlt2: A shark looking out of the water
shark.interestingFact: Sharks have been around for over 400 million years, making them older than dinosaurs. They have survived five mass extinction events, adapting over time to various environmental changes. This incredible resilience has led to the evolution of over 500 species of sharks today!

tiger.imgAlt2: A tiger running in the snow
tiger.interestingFact: Tigers are the largest cat species in the world and have unique striped patterns, much like human fingerprints. No two tigers have the same pattern of stripes, which helps them camouflage in their natural habitat. Additionally, tigers are excellent swimmers and often take to the water to cool off or hunt for prey!
